name: Mexican Chicken Chili and Rice
description: A one-skillet, family-friendly meal that is ready in 30 minutes. Make use of leftover, pre-cooked chicken for this fast, affordable meal. Serve in a bowl, wrapped in a flour tortilla or piled on a bed of greens; the possibilities are endless.
recipeIngredient: ½ medium white onion, finely chopped
2 cups diced or shredded cooked chicken
1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained
1 (5.4 ounce) package Knorr® Fiesta Sides™ - Mexican Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil over medium heat in a 10-inch skillet; cook onions until starting to turn translucent, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. Stir in chicken and chili powder. Add diced green chilies, fire roasted tomatoes with juices, pinto beans, and water. Cover and simmer until heated through and flavors blend, about 10 minutes.

Add Knorr Fiesta Sides, Mexican Rice and corn. Stir to combine, cover and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and cook, covered for 7 minutes. Turn off heat and let sit, covered, for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve garnished with cheese and tortilla chips, if desired.

review.reviewBody: I made this in my instant pot. I used frozen chicken pieces and poured in the tomatoes green chiles rice water and chili powder. Cooked on high pressure for thirty minutes then added the remaining ingredients for an extra 10 minutes. Good for a cold winter evening!

Quick and easy! I doubled this for my Mexican-food-loving family. I used one large onion two cloves garlic left over chopped chicken one can pinto and one can black beans one can diced tomatoes with green chilies and spices and one can regular diced tomatoes two cans corn two cans diced green chilies about a T of chilies powder and half a packet for f fajita mix. Cooked Mexican rice separately. Serve rice on the bottom top with chicken mixture garnish with cheese sour cream green onion and cilantro. Yum! Had it all done in less than 30 minutes.

I doubled this for my family of 5 (2 adults 3 kids)and had no left overs. I did substitute due to the fact my grocery store was limited so I grabbed the closest thing. I used a can of pinto bean and the pinto beans with the chili sauce (loads of extra flavor!). Instead of 14 total ounces of the green Chile s I used half which was 2 of the smaller cans. For the tomatoes I used a 10 oz can of fire roasted rotel and regular fire roasted tomatoes in the 14 oz can. I totally forgot to thaw the chicken the day before so I defrosted a little over 2 lbs of frozen chicken in the microwave right before cooking and it came out to a little over 4.5 cups when I chopped it up. I seasoned the raw chicken with the homemade seasoning salt recipe from AR. I also did not cook the chicken until I got to the step in the recipe...OOPS! I cooked it through and then proceed with the rest. Overall very filling easy and cheap. It was delicious and my picky eaters loved it. They said I needed to put it on my make again list lol. This would be a good filling for tortillas also. I added cheese to the final product and a tablespoon or 2 of sour cream. We also really enjoyed the corn! I ll probably add 3 cups next time this is made.

I didn't have corn or Mexican rice. Instead I made regular rice with the dish and added more salt and homemade taco seasoning with lots of shredded chicken. It was awesome! Made for a wonderful burrito too! Will definitely make again!
